info.description: Swagger 2.0 docs for the authentication/authorization Moneyhub API
info.title: Moneyhub Identity Service

get.summary: Retrieve all connections

parameters.description: Filter connections available to this client

patch.description: Requires **user:update** scope and for the API client to user their own consent screens i.e. not have Enforce user consent enabled. This endpoint can only currently be used to update the expiresAt field which is the date which the user has consented to.

parameters.description: The user ID
parameters.name: userId

parameters.description: The connection ID
parameters.name: connectionId

400.description: Unsuccessful Response - Bad Request - Invalid value

401.description: Unsuccessful Response - Not authorised - Missing authorization header - Invalid access Token

403.description: Unsuccessful Response - Forbidden - Invalid scopes, Insufficient client permissions

delete.description: The deletion of a connection will delete all data associated with it and it will revoke the consent the user granted. Requires **user:delete** scope.

parameters.description: The user ID
parameters.name: userId

parameters.description: The connection ID
parameters.name: connectionId

401.description: Unsuccessful Response - Not authorised - Missing authorization header - Invalid access Token

get.summary: Displays the internal consent screen for a given auth request
get.description: Requires client to be configured with an internal consent screen

parameters.description: The auth request Id
parameters.name: authRequestId

200.description: HTML response with configured internal consent screens for given auth request

404.description: Unsuccessful Response - Valid auth request could not be found

get.summary: Construct authorisation url to authenticate the end-user

parameters.description: ID of the client
parameters.name: client_id

parameters.description: The openid id:scope
parameters.name: scope

parameters.description: The redirect uri that the auth endpoint will redirect to on success
parameters.name: redirect_uri

parameters.description: The type of response
parameters.name: response_type

parameters.description: Request object formed from the required claims
parameters.name: request

parameters.description: Opaque value used to maintain state between the request and the callback.
parameters.name: state

parameters.description: Space delimited, case sensitive list of ASCII string values that specifies whether the Authorization Server prompts the End-User for reauthentication and consent.
parameters.name: prompt

302.description: A successful or erroneous authentication response

403.description: Unsuccessful Response - Invalid claims - Invalid scopes

post.description: Requires **Basic** auth header to be sent with the **client-id** & **client-secret** base64 encoded

sub.description: The user-id of the specific user

code.description: The authorization code for use when doing a client secret basic auth

client_id.description: The client id for use when doing a private key JWT auth

client_assertion.description: For use when doing a private key JWT auth

client_assertion_type.description: For use when doing a private key JWT auth

get.summary: Retrieve Open ID Connect configuration

200.description: A successful Open ID config response

get.summary: Retreive the bank icon as SVG when providing a valid bank reference listed under our available connections. Can also return PNG or JPG images when .png or .jpg file extension is added.
get.description: Please be aware we don’t have icons for all the connections we provide, when this is the case the route returns 404 as response unless the defaultIcon parameter is used.

parameters.description: When value is true the route will return the default icon instead of 404 if bank icon is not available
parameters.name: defaultIcon

parameters.description: The bank reference
parameters.name: bankRef

parameters.description: The pixel height for a PNG or JPG images
parameters.name: height

parameters.description: The pixel width for a PNG or JPG images
parameters.name: width

id.description: The id of the auth request

redirectUri.description: The redirect uri sent when creating the auth request

createdAt.description: The date that the auth request was created.

scope.description: The scope sent when creating the auth request

paymentId.description: Id of the payment when the auth request had the payment scope

syncId.description: Id of the initial sync, can be used to check status of sync

status.description: The status of the auth request

code.description: Authorization code returned by financial institution

id_token.description: Id token returned by financial institution

error_description.description: Error description returned by financial institution

redirectUri.description: One of the redirect uri that is set up under your API client. Required until separate bank registration is complete

userId.description: The id of the user. Required for second use case - account access.

scope.description: The scope for the auth request

connectionId.description: The connection id. Required when scope has 'reauth' or 'refresh'

amount.description: Payment amount in minor units of the currency, eg. pennies for GBP.

accountNumber.description: The account number of the payee

sortCode.description: The sort code of the payee

accountNumber.description: The account number of the payer

sortCode.description: The sort code of the payer

payerRef.description: Reference to display on payer's statement

readRefundAccount.description: Determines whether to read the refund account details

endToEndId.description: Unique identifier relevant to the transaction - Allowed characters (a-zA-Z0-9 :-).

accountNumber.description: The account number of the payee

sortCode.description: The sort code of the payee

reference.description: The name or description given to the standing order

day.description: The number of the day on which to repeat the payment

week.description: The number of the week on which to repeat the payment

month.description: The number of the month on which to repeat the payment

onlyWorkDays.description: Specifies whether the payment should only be made on working days

region.description: The region for dates of quarterly payments

numberOfPayments.description: The number of reucrring payments to complete the standing order

firstPaymentAmount.description: The value of the first payment in minor units of the currency, eg. pennies for GBP.

recurringPaymentAmount.description: The value of the next payment in minor units of the currency, eg. pennies for GBP.

finalPaymentAmount.description: The value of the final payment in minor units of the currency, eg. pennies for GBP.

currency.description: The currency of the standing order

accountNumber.description: The account number of the payee

sortCode.description: The sort code of the payee

reference.description: The name or description given to the recurring payment

validFromDate.description: The date from which the authorisation is effective

validToDate.description: The date to which the authorisation is effective

maximumIndividualAmount.description: The maximum single payment amount in minor units of the currency, eg. pennies for GBP.

currency.description: The currency of the maximum payment amount

amount.description: The maximum amount for this recurring payment limit

currency.description: The currency code for this recurring payment limit

periodType.description: The currency code for this recurring payment limit

periodAlignment.description: The currency code for this recurring payment limit

type.description: Specifies the type of payments to be made

paymentId.description: The id of the payment to reverse

amount.description: Payment amount in minor units of the currency, eg. pennies for GBP. It must be less than the payment that is being reversed. If not specified, it will default to the full amount of the original payment.

categorisationType.description: Type of transaction categorisation to use. Defaults to personal categories

benefitsCheck.description: If you require the connection to check for benefits payments, set this to true

counterpartiesCheck.description: If set, will check the connection for transactions with these counterparties. Will return true if one exists.

permissions.description: Defines permissions, which can enable functionalities like standing orders or beneficiaries. Can also be used to apply a lighter set of permissions than the default set. The behavior depends on 'permissionsAction'.

permissionsAction.description: Dictates how 'permissions' function. 'add' (default) to increment, or 'replace' to substitute default permissions.

expirationDateTime.description: The date time that an AIS consent will expire at. If no user ID is provided, expiry will default to 24 hours. Maximum allowed 90 days from now.

transactionFromDateTime.description: The date time transactions will be retrieved from. Maximum allowed 24 months before now.

sync.description: Options for the sync of a connection

enableAsync.description: If set to true, the sync for data will happen in the background

customerIpAddress.description: This field could be used to pass the custom customer's IP address to the bank.

customerLastLoggedTime.description: The time when the customer last logged in represented as an ISO 8601 date-time format including timezone

accountTypes.description: Filter which accounts to store based on their type

accountIdentification.description: Filter which accounts to store by providing either sort code and account number (concatenated), IBAN or PAN

id.description: The id of the auth request

redirectUri.description: The redirect uri sent when creating the auth request

createdAt.description: The date that the auth request was created.

scope.description: The scope sent when creating the auth request

paymentId.description: Id of the payment when the auth request had the payment scope

status.description: The status of the auth request

authUrl.description: The url at the financial institution to redirect the user towards

returnUrl.description: The url that the user will be returned to afer they have authorized

state.description: The `state` params that will be included in the query params or hash fragment when the user is redirected back

widgetId.description: The id of the widget used to render the pay-link

reference.description: Reference to display on payer's statement

amount.description: Payment amount in minor units of the currency, eg. pennies for GBP.

endToEndId.description: Unique identifier relevant to the transaction - Allowed characters (a-zA-Z0-9 :-).

useOnce.description: Boolean to indicate if the pay-link can only be consumed once.

usedAt.description: The date the pay-link was last used

archivedAt.description: The date the pay-link was archived

expiresAt.description: The date the pay-link will expire

createdAt.description: The date that the pay-link was created.

updatedAt.description: The date that the pay-link was modified.

widgetId.description: The id of the widget used to render the pay-link

sortCode.description: The sort code of the payee

accountNumber.description: The account number of the payee

displayName.description: The name of the payee to display the end user

reference.description: Reference to display on payer's statement

amount.description: Payment amount in minor units of the currency, eg. pennies for GBP.

endToEndId.description: Unique identifier relevant to the transaction - Allowed characters (a-zA-Z0-9 :-).

useOnce.description: Boolean to indicate if the pay-link can only be consumed once. Defaults to false.

expiresAt.description: The date the pay-link will expire

sortCode.description: The sort code of the payee

accountNumber.description: The account number of the payee

createdAt.description: The date that the payee was created.

modifiedAt.description: The date that the payee was modified.

readRefundAccount.description: Determines whether to read the refund account details

amount.description: Payment amount in minor units of the currency, eg. pennies for GBP.

payerRef.description: Reference to display on payer's statement

reversedPaymentId.description: The ID of the payment that was reversed by this payment

paymentSubmissionId.description: Original payment submission id from financial institution

bearer.description: Specifies which party/parties will bear the charges associated with the processing of the payment transaction.

type.description: Charge type, in a coded form.

amount.description: Charge amount in minor units of the currency, eg. pennies for GBP.

initiatedAt.description: The date that the payment was initiated

finalisedAt.description: The date that the payment was finalised

statusUpdateDateTime.description: The date that the payment status was last updated

expectedSettlementDateTime.description: The date that the settlement of the payment is expected

endToEndId.description: Unique identifier relevant to the transaction - Allowed characters (a-zA-Z0-9 :-).

id.description: The unique identity of the standing order

reference.description: The name or description given to the standing order

day.description: The number of the day on which to repeat the payment

week.description: The number of the week on which to repeat the payment

month.description: The number of the month on which to repeat the payment

onlyWorkDays.description: Specifies whether the payment should only be made on working days

region.description: The region for dates of quarterly payments

numberOfPayments.description: The number of reucrring payments to complete the standing order

firstPaymentAmount.description: The value of the first payment in minor units of the currency, eg. pennies for GBP.

recurringPaymentAmount.description: The value of the next payment in minor units of the currency, eg. pennies for GBP.

finalPaymentAmount.description: The value of the final payment in minor units of the currency, eg. pennies for GBP.

currency.description: The currency of the standing order

payee.description: The details to identify the beneficiary account. It requires the **standing_orders_detail:read** scope.

name.description: The name or names of the account owner(s)

sortCodeAccountNumber.description: For cash accounts. Populated with the 6 digit Sort Code and 8 digit Account Number.

iban.description: For cash accounts. Populated with the full IBAN number.

pan.description: For card accounts. Populated with the Primary Account Number.

iban.description: For cash accounts. Populated with the full IBAN number.

pan.description: For card accounts. Populated with the Primary Account Number.

reference.description: The name or description given to the recurring payment

validToDate.description: The date to which the authorisation is effective

createdAt.description: The date that the recurring payment was created

updatedAt.description: The date that the recurring payment was last updated

revokedAt.description: The date that the recurring payment was revoked

reference.description: The name or description given to the recurring payment

validFromDate.description: The date from which the authorisation is effective

validToDate.description: The date to which the authorisation is effective

maximumIndividualAmount.description: The maximum single payment amount in minor units of the currency, eg. pennies for GBP.

currency.description: The currency of the maximum payment amount

amount.description: The maximum amount for this recurring payment limit

currency.description: The currency code for this recurring payment limit

periodType.description: The currency code for this recurring payment limit

periodAlignment.description: The currency code for this recurring payment limit

type.description: Specifies the type of payments to be made

clientUserId.description: Id specified by API client on user's creation

clientId.description: API client Id that created the user

createdAt.description: The date the user was created

updatedAt.description: The date the user was last updated

scopes.description: Scope used when the user was created

managedBy.description: Represents how the user was created. Managed by client means that the api client created the user before hand according our second use case. Managed by user means that the user was created automatically when creating a connection according our first use case

lastAccessed.description: The date the user was last accessed. This property gets updated everytime a token is issued for this user

deletedAt.description: The date the user was deleted

clientName.description: Name of the api client that created the user

connectionIds.description: List of connection ids for the user

items.description: Connection id composed of the bank id and unique connection id

clientUserId.description: Optional Id specified by API client on user's creation

id.description: Connection id composed of the bank id and unique connection id

connectedOn.description: The date the connection was created.

lastUpdated.description: The date the connection was last successfully updated with live data from the provider.

lastSyncedAt.description: The latest date a sync to the connections was triggered. This date gets updated regardless of the sync being successful or not.

expiresAt.description: The date the connection will expire.

accountIds.description: Account ids that belong to the connection.

status.description: Current status of the connection. On 'error' status please refer to the 'error' field for more details. On 'never' status the connection will not be able to sync ever again as the bank/provider has been permanently removed from the list of available connections.

extendedStatus.description: Extended status for the connection, **please note** more values could be added to this field.

error.description: Error code when the connection has the error status

userConsentedAt.description: The date the user last consented

tppConsent.description: Indicates if a connection is suitable for the shortened reconsent journey instead of a full reauthentication with the ASPSP. Currently only applies to api connections.

singleSyncOnly.description: Indicates if a connection will sync only once and will not sync again automatically without input from the user. In these cases the refresh flow or re auth should be used. Currently only applies to legacy connections.

useMfa.description: Indicates if MFA authentication is required for this connection. Currently only applies to legacy connections.

expiresAt.description: The date to set the connection consent to expire.

connectionId.description: Connection id composed of the bank id and unique connection id

accounts.description: List of accounts that were synced

providerId.description: The ID of the account held by the banking provider

accountId.description: The ID of the account when stored by Moneyhub

postConnectionEnrichmentStatus.description: Shows whether the regular transactions for the given account has been synchronised

postConnectionEnrichedAt.description: The time at which regular transactions were retrieved at

correlationId.description: Id that identifies the request and can be used to ask for more details related to the error

id.description: Bank connection id (used to request an authorization url for a specific bank)

type.description: The type of bank connection (api, legacy or test)

parentRef.description: This property is now deprecated. Please use bankRef instead

bankRef.description: Reference that uniquely identities a set of connections as being part of the same institution. It is used to group a set of connections by the banking institution they refer to. It can alse be used to retrieve the bank icon.

isBeta.description: A beta boolean value flagging which connection is currently being developed and may not have a 100% success rate

singleSyncOnly.description: A boolean value flagging if this connection can be reSynced after the initial auth request. If this flag is true then the connection will need to go through the reAuth Process every time.

useMfa.description: Indicates if MFA authentication is required for this connection

accountTypes.description: An array containing the types of accounts supported by the connection

beta.description: A beta boolean value flagging which accounts types for that connection are currently being developed and may not have a 100% success rate

iconUrl.description: The url of the bank icon SVG. Please be aware we don’t have icons for all the connections we provide. For the missing icons you can either use your own set or use our generic bank icon found at this url: https://identity.moneyhub.co.uk/bank-icons/default

userTypes.description: An array of user account types supported by the bank connection

payments.description: An array of payments capabilities for the bank

status.description: The connection status for the provider

sync.description: The sync status of the provider

auth.description: The status of authorisations for the provider

monthsInitialConsent.description: The initial transaction limit on initial consent

months.description: The transaction limit after initial consent

description.example: 6 years for Current and Savings, 6 months for cards (only in first 45 mins)
description.description: Further information about the nature of the history

isTest.description: A boolean value flagging which connections are test connections

friendlyName.description: The readable name of the bank (without terms such as Open Banking)

connectionGroups.description: A list of connections groups that the connection belongs to e.g. various connections may belong to a single provider like Barclays or Halifax

authorization_endpoint.description: URL of the OP's OAuth 2.0 Authorization Endpoint

claims_parameter_supported.description: Boolean value specifying whether the OP supports use of the claims parameter, with true indicating support

claims_supported.description: A list of the Claim Names of the Claims that the OpenID Provider MAY be able to supply values for. Note that for privacy or other reasons, this might not be an exhaustive list

code_challenge_methods_supported.description: A list of Proof Key for Code Exchange (PKCE) code challenge methods supported by this authorization server

grant_types_supported.description: A list of the OAuth 2.0 Grant Type values that Moneyhub supports

id_token_signing_alg_values_supported.description: A list of the JWS signing algorithms (alg values) supported for the ID Token to encode the Claims in a JWT

issuer.description: URL using the https scheme assert as the Issuer identifier. This also MUST be identical to the iss Claim value in ID Tokens issued from this Issuer

jwks_uri.description: URL of the Moneyhub APIs JSON Web Key Set document

registration_endpoint.description: URL of the OP's Dynamic Client Registration Endpoint

authorization_response_iss_parameter_sup.description: Indicates whether the authorization server provides the iss parameter in the authorization response

response_modes_supported.description: A list of the OAuth 2.0 response_mode values supported

response_types_supported.description: A list of the OAuth 2.0 response_types values supported

scopes_supported.description: A list of the OAuth 2.0 [RFC6749] scope values that this server supports

subject_types_supported.description: A list of Subject Identifier types supported by this provider

token_endpoint_auth_signing_alg_values_s.description: A list of Client Authentication methods supported by this Token Endpoint

token_endpoint.description: URL of the OAuth 2.0 Token Endpoint

pushed_authorization_request_endpoint.description: URL of the pushed authorization request endpoint

request_object_signing_alg_values_suppor.description: a list of the JWS signing algorithms (alg values) supported for Request Objects

request_parameter_supported.description: Boolean value specifying whether the provider supports use of the request parameter

request_uri_parameter_supported.description: Boolean value specifying whether the OP supports use of the request_uri parameter

require_request_uri_registration.description: Boolean value specifying whether the OP requires any request_uri values used to be pre-registered using the request_uris registration parameter

introspection_endpoint_auth_methods_supp.description: Auth methods support on the introspection endpoint

introspection_endpoint_auth_signing_alg_.description: A list of the JWS signing algorithms supported by the introspection endpoint for the signature on the JWT

dpop_signing_alg_values_supported.description: A list of the JWS alg values supported by the authorization server for DPoP proof JWTs

revocation_endpoint_auth_methods_support.description: A list of client authentication methods supported by this revocation endpoint

revocation_endpoint_auth_signing_alg_val.description: a list of the JWS signing algorithms supported by the revocation endpoint for the signature on the JWT

id_token_encryption_alg_values_supported.description: A list of the JWE encryption algorithms (alg values) supported for the ID Token to encode the Claims in a JWT

id_token_encryption_enc_values_supported.description: A list of the JWE encryption algorithms (enc values) supported for the ID Token to encode the Claims in a JWT

request_object_encryption_alg_values_sup.description: A list of the JWE encryption algorithms (alg values) supported for Request Objects

request_object_encryption_enc_values_sup.description: A list of the JWE encryption algorithms (enc values) supported for Request Objects

claim_types_supported.description: A list of the Claim Types supported

all_connections_endpoint.description: URL to retrieve metadata for all connections

api_connections_endpoint.description: URL to retrieve metadata for api (Open Banking) connections

legacy_connections_endpoint.description: URL to retrieve metadata for legacy connections

test_connections_endpoint.description: URL to retrieve metadata for test connections

beta_connections_endpoint.description: URL to retrieve metadata for connections still in beta

zoopla_connections_endpoint.description: URL to retrieve metadata for the zoopla connection

mouseprice_connections_endpoint.description: URL to retrieve metadata for the mouseprice connection

autotrader_connections_endpoint.description: URL to retrieve metadata for the autotrader connection
